page.title: 03Industry and Employment.
page.content: The major industry is area is farming, which owing to mechanisation employs very few people. An overage of 3 workers (often members of the same family) is sufficient to manage most farms throughout the year,until the busy harvest season when contract labour is brought in. The combined Dunge farms illustraite how the employment picture has changed in the last 20 years. Today 5 men are employed on the 2 farms to look after 200 dairy cows. In the 1960's 16 men were needed to cope with 60 cows. A small meat boning and packing business occupies premises on the site of demolished ex R.A.F buildings in the square ref.03900155. It was once an abbatoir, but animals are no longer slaughtered there. A few women are enployed making pies and sauages.
